abstract: Cisco‘s acquisition strategy has been a bit of a puzzle lately. The company, best known for making routers that direct network traffic, got Silicon Valley talking earlier this month when it bought the technology assets of Tribe.net, a mostly forgotten social networking site. On Thursday, Cisco announced another offbeat (and much bigger) deal: the $3.2 billion purchase of WebEx, a Web-based video conferencing service.
lead_paragraph: Cisco‘s acquisition strategy has been a bit of a puzzle lately. The company, best known for making routers that direct network traffic, got Silicon Valley talking earlier this month when it bought the technology assets of Tribe.net, a mostly forgotten social networking site. On Thursday, Cisco announced another offbeat (and much bigger) deal: the $3.2 billion purchase of WebEx, a Web-based video conferencing service.

headline.main: Cisco’s WebEx Deal: Sizzle, Steak or Both?
